MODE.NAME: help
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Displays a detailed help message and quits

MODE.NAME: rebuild-protein
MODE.DESCRIPTION: As it says will rebuild a protein given the target structue -- the for runner to ca-trace and is no longer valid so DO NOT USE IT

MODE.NAME: verify-pdb
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Read in the PDB file and perform as exhaustive as possible verification of the file. If verify-signal-errors is true, then RAPPER will eprintf if any truly dangerous anomolies are detected. Otherwise only warnings will be printed.

MODE.NAME: calc-edm-map
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Calculate a theoretical electron density map for a PDB file

MODE.NAME: local-move
MODE.DESCRIPTION: 4 residue window moves to change conformation

MODE.NAME: calcrmsd
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Calculates lots of comparisons between two structures, including the global and local RMSD and chi1 accuracies over several subsets of the atom and structure.

MODE.NAME: psa
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the solvent accessible surface area of a PDB file

MODE.NAME: test
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Test slot. Shouldn't do anything sophisticated.

MODE.NAME: calc-saxs-profile
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Finds distribution of pairwise distances betn atoms as in SAXS.

MODE.NAME: multi-model
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Turns a list of PDB files into a single, multi-model PDB file.

MODE.NAME: multi-model-bfactor
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Computes the mean-square displacement bfactor of PDB from PDBS.

MODE.NAME: comparative
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Comparative modelling by satisfaction of spatial restraints

MODE.NAME: fread
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Run the RAPPER version of FREAD to extract compatible fragments from a set of PDB files.

MODE.NAME: mean-structure
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Given a multi-model PDB file, writes out the geometric mean structure of the models.

PARAM.NAME: joinpdb-signal-error-on-empty-fragments
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then if either of two fragments to join in joinpdb mode cannot be read, an error will be signaled. If false, and only one fragment can be read, then it alone will be placed in the output PDB file.

PARAM.NAME: error-for-no-models
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then if no models can be found during conformational search, an error will be signalled. RAPPER doesn't really care if it can't find anything, and if false, then empty PDB files will be generated.

PARAM.NAME: assign-only-bad-sidechains
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then only sidechains with missing atoms or bad rotamer states in the PDB structure will be reassigned. Otherwise all residues between start and stop will be reassigned.

PARAM.NAME: rapper-dir
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The path to the rappermc directory.

PARAM.NAME: pdb
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Standard argument name for the principal input PDB file for many modes. The file must exist.

PARAM.NAME: pdbs
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A list of PDBs from the command line

PARAM.NAME: pdb2
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Standard argument name for the principal input PDB file for many modes. The file must exist.

PARAM.NAME: pdb-out
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Standard PDB output filename

PARAM.NAME: chain-id
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The chain ID of the protein to use from the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: chain-id2
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The chain ID of the second protein to use from the PDB file for calcrmsd

PARAM.NAME: range
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The range of residues of the protein to use from the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: ignore
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The range of residues of the protein to ignore in the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: rangesources
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Phipsi sources can be specified for residue-ranges with this option. e.g. if --range option has been used as A:12A-A:25, then --rangesources 1-3,TRIMER_SOURCE,/tmp/tri,5-10,TETRAMER_SOURCE,/tmp/tetra specifies that trimer-source derived from /tmp/tri be used to generate phi-psi's for 1st-3rd (both inclusive) residues in that range, and tetramer-source derived from /tmp/tetra be used for 5th-10th residues in the same range. The residue numbers in --rangesources are internal to range in --range, starting with 1. Hence --rangesource shdnt be used with multiple ranges in --range.

PARAM.NAME: protonate
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The range of residues of the protein to protonate

PARAM.NAME: deprotonate
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The range of residues of the protein to deprotonate

PARAM.NAME: start-residue
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The PDB index into the PDB file of the starting residue.

PARAM.NAME: start-residue2
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The PDB index into the PDB file of the starting residue.

PARAM.NAME: stop-residue
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The PDB index into the PDB file of the ending residue.

PARAM.NAME: length
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of residues to model between START and STOP.

PARAM.NAME: n-models-wanted
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of models to generate.

PARAM.NAME: attempts
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of individual samples where allowed during search.

PARAM.NAME: sequence
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The amino acid sequence of the residues to model.

PARAM.NAME: output-seq
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Filename for the sequence to output

PARAM.NAME: output-malf
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Filename for the sequence to output

PARAM.NAME: analyze-homstrad-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: verbose
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Determines how much output RAPPER generates. High numbers generate more output.

PARAM.NAME: runs-directory
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The directory where result files will be written.

PARAM.NAME: print-mean-phipsi-propensity-of-band
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Set to true if mean propensity of sampled phipsi's are desired.

PARAM.NAME: use-choral-output
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If you want to take the alignment info from choral .clr file

PARAM.NAME: print-dummy-c-anchor-residue
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Add dummy C-terminal anchor residue to models PDB files?

PARAM.NAME: write-models
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write models (what this means is context dependent) to disk?

PARAM.NAME: write-user-remarks
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write USER remarks to PDB files?\

PARAM.NAME: write-individual-models
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write each model to its own PDB file (true), or to a single multi-model PDB file (false)?

PARAM.NAME: write-logs
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write logs / analyses to disk?

PARAM.NAME: phipsi-states-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The path to the phi/psi states file.

PARAM.NAME: n-phipsi-bins
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Determines the resolution of the phi/psi maps. The maps will be scaled to have dimensions n-phipsi-bins^2. A value of -1 means to uses the resolution contained in the map file itself.

PARAM.NAME: use-uniform-phipsi-propensities
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, propensities for individual states in the phi/psi maps will be ignored, effectively giving all non-zero propensity bins equal propensity.

PARAM.NAME: sample-cis-peptides
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, cis peptides will be sampled based on this probability of occurrence for each amino acid type.

PARAM.NAME: secondary-structure-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A string of the desired secondary structure states to enforce for each modeled residue. H for helix, E for strand, P for positive phi, and C for coil (i.e. unrestrainted).

PARAM.NAME: numeric-secstr-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A string of phi-psi ranges to impose numeric limits on secondary structure for each modeled residue. e.g. '{(-100,-90),(50,60)}{(-119,-110),(55,65)}{(-150,-130),(45,65)}' {(phimin,phimax),(psimin,psimax)}

PARAM.NAME: enforce-secondary-structure-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce secondary structure restraints?

PARAM.NAME: secondary-structure-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness of secondary structure restraints

PARAM.NAME: restraints-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The path to a file containing additional restraints to enforce during conformational search.

PARAM.NAME: use-exhaustive-search
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If exhaustive search is available in the current mode, use an exhaustive enumeration of states instead of a stochastic search to generation models.

PARAM.NAME: keep-models-from-exhaustive-search
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If exhaustive search is enabled and supported in the current mode, actually try and keep all of the models for the standard analyses and for writing out to disk. This will undoubtedly cause a memory overflow for all but the smallest search spaces.

PARAM.NAME: generate-kinemage
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we generate a Kinemage visualization of the RAPPER restraints and models? The kinemage files are pretty huge, so let's not generate them by default.

PARAM.NAME: probe-radius-scale-factor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Multiplier that determines the hard-sphere excluded-volume radius of atoms as a function of their van der Waals radii. The hard-sphere radius is probe-radius-scale-factor * van der Waals radii.

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-radius-reduction
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The factor by which we reduce the radii of hard-sphere excluded volume interactions when at least one atoms is from a sidechain. That is, if this parameter is 0.5, then a sidechain atom can approach upto twice as close to any other atom as normal.

PARAM.NAME: global-space-grid-margin
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The margin size, in angstroms, from the nearest atom to the space grid box. Determines how far the global space grid box will extend from the protein surface.

PARAM.NAME: space-grid-resolution
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of space grid bins per angstrom to use in the space grid calculations.

PARAM.NAME: include-hetatms-in-grid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Include HETATMs in grid (space grid, electron density map) calculations?

PARAM.NAME: include-unknown-atoms-in-grid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Include atoms of unknown type in grid (space grid, electron density map) calculations?

PARAM.NAME: analyze-space-grid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If > 0, then some statistics about the space grid are printed to the screen. If > 1, then RAPPER exits after the analysis.

PARAM.NAME: write-pdb-of-search
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Generate pdb of bands as produced during modelling appended to search.pdb

PARAM.NAME: write-restraints-to-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Writes to file the coordinates and type of restraints being imposed

PARAM.NAME: generate-o-compatible-pdb-files
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Generate PDB files in the non-standard O format?

PARAM.NAME: read-cns-compatible-pdb-files
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Omit weird atoms with 9999.0, 9999.0, 9999.0 and zero B-factor?

PARAM.NAME: discard-native-b-factors
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: When we write out the native.pdb file, discard native B-factors?

PARAM.NAME: models-get-native-bfactors
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: When we write out the RAPPER models, use the native B-factors for the model B-factors?

PARAM.NAME: models-get-native-headers
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: When we write out the RAPPER models, add the native PDB headers to the models?

PARAM.NAME: models-get-native-hetatms
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: When we write out the RAPPER models, add native PDB hetero-atoms to the models?

PARAM.NAME: out-of-reach-margin
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum distance from the model dummy anchor CA atom and the CA atom of the N terminal anchor of the framework. A tighter value gives better geometry.

PARAM.NAME: strict-anchors
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then RAPPER will be very particular about the quality of the N and C terminal anchor residues. This is primarily useful for loop modelling where the two anchors play a major role in model accuracy.

PARAM.NAME: allow-chain-breaks-near-anchors
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then RAPPER will allow N and C terminal anchors adjucent to chain breaks. This is essential for any mode where the actual residues being rebuilt are not in the PDB file and there *must* have chain breaks next to the anchors. In most cases, however, it is not a good idea to have chain breaks near anchor residues.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-strict-anchor-geometry
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then restraints are added to ensure high-quality C terminal anchor geometry. This option, when enabled, can be expensive computationally, and may in fact cause the modelling to fail. On the other hand, models produced with this enabled will have better anchor geometries.

PARAM.NAME: optimize-n-movable-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of residues next to the C-terminal anchor whose atoms are permitted to move.

PARAM.NAME: simulated-annealing-steps-multiplier
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A standard, reasonable simulated annealing schedule is set in the optimization code. This value determines how many moves to take at each step of the schedule. For instance, if the schedule is {10, 2}, {5, 0}, and this value is 20, then the final schedule is 200 moves at 2 degrees followed by 100 movies at 0 degrees.

PARAM.NAME: simulated-annealing-use-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: During optimization, apply the restraint network?

PARAM.NAME: print-bonded-energies
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we print out detailed information about the deviations from ideal geometry before and after optimization?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce any restraints at all?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-clash-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Clash restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-mainchain-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce positional restraints for main chain atoms?

PARAM.NAME: optional-mainchain-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, mainchain restraints will be made optional.

PARAM.NAME: mainchain-restraint-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the mainchain restraints spheres

PARAM.NAME: non-clustered-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the mainchain restraints spheres for non choral clustered regions

PARAM.NAME: mainchain-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for mainchain atomic positional restraints

PARAM.NAME: enforce-short-sidechain-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce positional restraints for side chain CB + CG atoms?

PARAM.NAME: short-sidechain-restraint-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the short sidechain (CB and gamma positions) restraint spheres

PARAM.NAME: short-sidechain-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for short sidechain (CB and gamma position) atomic positional restraints

PARAM.NAME: enforce-long-sidechain-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce positional restraints for remaining side chain atoms (delta positions and beyond)?

PARAM.NAME: long-sidechain-restraint-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the long sidechain restraint spheres

PARAM.NAME: long-sidechain-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for long (delta position and beyond) sidechain atomic positional restraints

PARAM.NAME: enforce-ca-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: CA atomic positional restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: use-ideal-ca-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Use the closest CA position to the known target as bases for the restraint network ie optimal restraint info put.

PARAM.NAME: ca-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for CA atomic positional restraints

PARAM.NAME: ca-restraint-noise
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The magnitude, in Angstroms, of the noise to be added to the CA restraint spheres

PARAM.NAME: ca-trace-modulus
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of residues to skip between CA restrained atoms (1 = every CA atom).

PARAM.NAME: restraint-propagation-distance
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The number of residues around which restraints should be propagated, if possible. For now, only for CA restraints.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-n-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: N atomic positional restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-o-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: O atomic positional restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-c-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: C atomic positional restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-h-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: H atomic positional restraints enforced during conformational search?

PARAM.NAME: enforce-sidechain-centroid-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce restraints on the sidechain centroid?

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-centroid-restraint-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the sidechain centroid restraints

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-centroid-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The strictness of the sidechain centroid restraints

PARAM.NAME: enforce-sidechain-chi1-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce restraints on the sidechain chi-1 dihedral angle?

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-chi1-restraint-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximally allowed deviation, in degrees, from the native chi-1 angle

PARAM.NAME: enforce-hydrogen-bonding-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce hydrogen bonding restraints for conserved H-bonds?

PARAM.NAME: hydrogen-bonding-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for hydrogen bonding restraints

PARAM.NAME: backbone-hydrogen-bonding-restraint-strictness
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Strictness for hydrogen bonding restraints

PARAM.NAME: population-size
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The size of the ensemble of conformations to simultaneous bring through the restraint network in the population conformational search algorithm. Larger values means more conformational sampling but increased computational cost.

PARAM.NAME: require-unique-structures
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce independence among the conformations generated by the search algorithms? If so, then solutions that share even one common residue (excluding fixed residues) will be rejected.

PARAM.NAME: population-max-passes
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of passes allowed before the population search algorithm stops searching for the ensemble of conformations. Larger values means more attempts to solve the restraint network.

PARAM.NAME: max-pop-show-auditions
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of pop shows to collect an entire model solution.

PARAM.NAME: population-max-free-generations
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: During conformational search, a population of distinct conformations is brought through the restraint network. The distance to the closest common ancestor residue (shared by all members of the population) will be limited to this number. If the common closest ancestor is too far back, the 'best' ancestor population-max-free-generations back will be selected and all conformations not sharing this ancestor will be eliminated from the current population. A value > 0 enforces a maximum distance, while 0 lets the distance grow without bound.

PARAM.NAME: add-common-ancestors-to-spacegrid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should common ancestors (shared by all members of the current population) be added to the space grid for efficient hard-spheres overlap detection?

PARAM.NAME: population-print-restraint-failure-rates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we print out a summary of the restraint failure rate at each extension step of the population search algorithm? If true, then a summary (detailing basically {restraint, number of failures}) will be printed for each restraint applicable at that position.

PARAM.NAME: population-enumerate-for-best-anchor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If there is a C-terminal anchor residue, enumerate all conformations of the last and dummy anchor residues to find the best joint? This can be a bit expensive, but is worth it since our optimizers are pretty pathetic.

PARAM.NAME: ab-initio-box-dimension
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Box dimensions for ab initio modelling. Must be big enough to contain the target protein.

PARAM.NAME: max-model-similarity
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The maximum RMSD (in Angstrom) permitted between any two generated models. The higher the value, the greater the enforced diversity within the generated ensemble.

PARAM.NAME: ignore-hetatms
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Ignore HETATM records when reading PDB files?

PARAM.NAME: contact-distance-margin
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Error margin of contact (pairwise) distances.

PARAM.NAME: contact-distance-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance for two atoms to make a contact.

PARAM.NAME: contact-restraint-penetrance
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Penetrance of pairwise distance contact restraint.

PARAM.NAME: include-sidechain-centroid-contacts
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: contact-min-seq-separation
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimal sequence separation for two residues to be in contact.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-contact-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Enforce contact distance restraints?

PARAM.NAME: contacts-are-discrete
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Contacts either satisfy maximal pairwise distance (discrete = true) or satisfy absolute distance bounds (false).

PARAM.NAME: contact-add-not-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Add restraints to explicitly prevent contacts? From the native structure, they are contacts with distances > contact-distance-threshold.

PARAM.NAME: frag1-is-master
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Is the first fragment provided (PDB1) the master fragment for calculating RMSDs between dissimilar protein structures (i.e. with nonidentical sequences)?

PARAM.NAME: calcrmsd-per-residue
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Calculate the RMSD for each residue along the chain?

PARAM.NAME: start-chain-id
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The protein chain ID to use from the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: stop-chain-id
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The protein chain ID to use from the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: renumber-residues-from
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Renumber residues starting from this number. Only with stripping fragments from PDB files.

PARAM.NAME: clear-chain-ids
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Clear protein chain IDs from fragments?

PARAM.NAME: cluster-upgma
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Use UPGMA clustering?

PARAM.NAME: cluster-only-split
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Perform no clustering: just split multi-model PDB file into individual model PDB files?

PARAM.NAME: cluster-superimpose
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Superimpose? The RMSD will then be a local RMSD instead of a global RMSD.

PARAM.NAME: cluster-include-atoms
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Number of atoms to include in RMSD calculation between structures.

PARAM.NAME: cluster-output-clusters
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Print details of calculated clusters?

PARAM.NAME: cluster-rmsd-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximal RMSD, in Angstroms, for clustering structures.

PARAM.NAME: cluster-output-prefix
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Prefix string for the PDB files of clusters. For instance, if this is "foo", then cluster representatives will be written out as foo001.pdb, foo002.pdb, etc.

PARAM.NAME: pdb-set
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A file containing a list of PDB files.

PARAM.NAME: pdb-path
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The path to PDB files.

PARAM.NAME: pdb-prefix
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The filename prefix of PDB files.

PARAM.NAME: pdb-extension
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The filename extension of the PDB files.

PARAM.NAME: subst-filename
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The path to the file containing the FREAD substitution tables.

PARAM.NAME: fread-max-structure-score
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: fread-max-sequence-score
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: fread-max-pid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: fread-include-sequence-z-score
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: fread-include-structure-z-score
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: use-contact-filters
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then contact filters will be added.

PARAM.NAME: map
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Path to mfo-nfc where m != n electron density map.

PARAM.NAME: diff-map
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Path to fo - fc electron density map.

PARAM.NAME: use-edm-filters
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density filters will be added if a map file is given.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-mainchain-min-sigma-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density map restraints will be added if a map file is given.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-mainchain-min-cc-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density FOO

PARAM.NAME: edm-mainchain-min-sigma
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only mainchain atoms in a position with greater standard deviation than this is considered to satify the electron density map restraint.

PARAM.NAME: edm-mainchain-min-cc
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only mainchain atoms with correlation coefficients >= this parameter satify the electron density map min-cc restraint.

PARAM.NAME: optional-edm-mainchain-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then the 0.0 (positive density) mainchain restraint will be made optional. If false, then the mainchain will be unconditionally forced to lie in positive density. This is primarily useful when tracing through a structure with regions in very poor (non-existent) density.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-sidechain-min-sigma-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density map restraints will be added if a map file is given.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-sidechain-min-cc-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density map CC restraints will be added if a map file is given.

PARAM.NAME: edm-sidechain-min-sigma
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only mainchain atoms in a position with greater standard deviation than this is considered to satify the electron density map restraint.

PARAM.NAME: edm-sidechain-min-cc
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only mainchain atoms in a position with greater standard deviation than this is considered to satify the electron density map restraint.

PARAM.NAME: edm-rebuild-poor-regions
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then the regions to rebuild will be calculated according to consistence with the provided electron density map.

PARAM.NAME: edm-poor-region-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Regions with fits worse than this number of standard deviations are considered 'poor'

PARAM.NAME: edm-poor-region-buffer-size
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If a region fits poorly, the entire region plus this number of residues on either size are flagged for rebuilding.

PARAM.NAME: edm-poor-region-includes-bad-phipsi
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, residues with poor phi/psi values will be added to the regions to be rebuilt

PARAM.NAME: edm-fit
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then a lot of effort will be put into getting conformations that fit the electron density map..

PARAM.NAME: only-add-edm-restraints-on-good-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then electron density map restraints will only be added to residues whose QUALITY_FLAG is GOOD.

PARAM.NAME: edm-min-average-density-for-elimination
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: all-restraints-are-optional
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then all restrains are made optional. This is dangerous but necessary when you *can't* gaurentee that input structure is reasonable but you have to produce models.

PARAM.NAME: restraints-are-pass-optional
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then all restraints on the anchor/bootstrap are pass optional.

PARAM.NAME: enforce-out-of-reach-restraints
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then out-of-reach restraints will be enforced where appropriate.

PARAM.NAME: rapdf
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Path to the RAPDF statistical potential file.

PARAM.NAME: default-mainchain-b-factor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The mainchain heavy atoms will have their B factors set to this value in the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: default-sidechain-b-factor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The sidechain heavy atoms will have their B factors set to this value in the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: default-hydrogen-b-factor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The hydrogen atoms will have their B factors set to this value in the PDB file

PARAM.NAME: scl-max-bfactor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum allowed atomic B-factor in residues for deriving Sidechain Conformer Library (SCL).

PARAM.NAME: scl-min-occupancy
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimum required occupancy for atoms in residues for deriving SCL.

PARAM.NAME: scl-rmsd-cutoff
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum global RMSD (over sidechain heavy atoms) cutoff for clustering conformers in SCL.

PARAM.NAME: scl-chi1-deviation-cutoff
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum allowed Chi-1 angle deviation for clustering conformers in SCL. Prevents different rotamer states to be clustered together due to low RMSD.

PARAM.NAME: scl-chi1-deviation-cutoff-for-propensity
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum allowed chi-1 angle deviation for clustering similar conformers in deriving SCL propensities.

PARAM.NAME: scl-n-phipsi-bins-for-propensity
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Number of phi/psi bins for deriving backbone-dependent propensities. For SCL.

PARAM.NAME: scl-output-pdb-per-residue-type
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out individual PDB files per residue type.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-without-hydrogens
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out PDB files without hydrogens. Useful for the SCL.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-without-sidechains
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out PDB files without sidechains.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-no-chain
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out PDB files without chain IDs.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-only-ca-trace
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out PDB files with only CA trace.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-clean-renumbering
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Renumber entire structure and remove chain IDs

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-without-hets
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out PDB files without HET groups.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-residues-as-models
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out individual residues as separate MODELs in the PDB output. Useful for SCL.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-elements
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out the element type for atoms in PDB output.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-no-altlocs
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Do not write out alternate locations for atoms in PDB output.

PARAM.NAME: output-pdb-as-pqr
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Write out structure as a pqr (coordinates, charges, radii) in the PDB output. Used for MEAD.

PARAM.NAME: pqr-parameter-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: File that contains the PQR parameters for writing out PQR files for MEAD. We use the PARSE parameter set by Sitkoff et al.

PARAM.NAME: output-mead-sites
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Output titratable sites for MEAD

PARAM.NAME: mead-sites-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Output titratable sites for MEAD

PARAM.NAME: fail-to-fix-mutate-to-gly
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: When fixing side chains, upon failure (cannot put sidechain on) mutate to a Gly.

PARAM.NAME: protonate-nter
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Protonate N-terminus as NH3+

PARAM.NAME: protonate-cter
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Protonate C-terminus as COOH

PARAM.NAME: detect-waters-around-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: List water molecules that lie around range of residues

PARAM.NAME: fix-missing-sidechains
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Try to fix missing sidechains.

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-clustering-positional-error-cutoff
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: use-sidechain-propensities
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-propensity-type
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: use-exhaustive-sidechain-assignment-optionally
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: use-exhaustive-sidechain-assignment-optionally
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: enable-sidechain-elimination
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only for loop modelling with only clash checking and perhaps with the mother of all rotamer libraries the SCL.

PARAM.NAME: use-all-restraints-for-sidechain-elimination
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Only for crazy motherfuckers.

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-library
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-mode
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: output-invalid-sidechains-too
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: joy
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: JOY file. Contains 3D annotation of a structure-based alignment.

PARAM.NAME: pir
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PIR alignment file

PARAM.NAME: clr
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: clr cluster file

PARAM.NAME: rampage-data-dir
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Directory where the RAMPAGE parameter files are

PARAM.NAME: rampage-title-filename
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: This is the file that contains the title (i.e. the filename of the uploader)

PARAM.NAME: rampage-kinemage-template
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Kinemage template for RAMPAGE output

PARAM.NAME: rampage-kinemage
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Kinemage output filename for RAMPAGE

PARAM.NAME: rampage-enable-kinemage
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Output Kinemage for RAMPAGE?

PARAM.NAME: rampage-postscript
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PostScript output filename for RAMPAGE

PARAM.NAME: rampage-enable-postscript
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Output PostScript for RAMPAGE?

PARAM.NAME: rampage-contours
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: rampage-rectangles
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: rampage-title
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: rampage-background-dpi
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: rampage-no-labels
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: rampage-only-data
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PAUL

PARAM.NAME: seed
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The initial value for the random seed.

PARAM.NAME: load-parameters
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Path to parameter override XML file. These are typically generated by RAPPER and can be used to re-run a RAPPER job.

PARAM.NAME: needs-initializations
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Very low level variable that controls whether low-level RAPPER initialiations are performed. Small modes (calcrmsd) probably want to disable initializations. DO NOT MUCK ABOUT WITH THIS PARAMETER.

PARAM.NAME: needs-xray
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Very low level variable that controls whether xray parameters are read in or calculated. Can be expensive to compute.

PARAM.NAME: needs-phipsi-maps
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Low level variable that controls whether phi/psi maps will be used. Some small modes that do not care about phi/psi values probably want to disable this for performance reasons. HOWEVER, DO NOT MUCK ABOUT WITH THIS PARAMETER.

PARAM.NAME: verify-signal-errors
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: verify-setup
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Population search will abort with error code 0, instead of actually doing any work. Very useful if we want to test our setup but not actually do a potentially large amount of work.

PARAM.NAME: verify-structures
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we verify input PDB structures and signal eprintf if it has problems?

PARAM.NAME: verify-structures-for-energy-calculations
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we verify input PDB structures assuming that the file is intended for energy calculations with TINKER? TINKER is very brittle and many types of valid PDB constructs will cause TINKER to segfault.

PARAM.NAME: verify-geometry
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: During calculations, should we verify that the constructed amino acids have the expected geometry. This is expensive but safe.

PARAM.NAME: enable-incremental-gc
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we enable incremental and generational garbage collection in the Boehm collector? When enabled, memory allocation requests induce slight (incremental) collection of garbage objects in memory. Further, a generational scheme is used to reduce tracing of very old (static) data structures, of which there are many in RAPPER.

MODE.NAME: calc-edm-map
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Calculate a theoretical electron density map for a PDB file

MODE.NAME: local-move
MODE.DESCRIPTION: 4 residue window moves to change conformation

MODE.NAME: calcrmsd
MODE.DESCRIPTION: Calculates lots of comparisons between two structures, including the global and local RMSD and chi1 accuracies over several subsets of the atom and structure.

PARAM.NAME: minimum-anisotropy
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If the anisotropy of the distribution of atoms in the ensemble of structures provided by mean-structure is below this threshold, then the mean atom will be modelled with an anisotropic thermal bfactor. Atoms with anisotropy greater than thershold this will be modelled as isotropic.

PARAM.NAME: adjust-anisotropy-by-msd
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then a anistropic displacement ellipsoids will be adjusted by atomic b factor mean square deviations.

PARAM.NAME: zero-bfactors-for-isotropic-atoms
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If true, then mean atoms with insufficiently anisotropic displacements will have their bfactors set to 0 in mean-structures. If false, then such atoms will have bfactors that are the average of the bfactors of the individual atoms.

PARAM.NAME: shortle-data
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: modeller-atm-files-directory
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Directory for writing out .atm files for running MODELLER

PARAM.NAME: modeller-top-filename
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Filename for the .top file for running MODELLER

PARAM.NAME: core-max-dist-invariant-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance, in Angstrom, between equivalent CA atoms to belong to the common superimposable core.

PARAM.NAME: core-min-fraction-invariant-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimal fraction of residues (CA atoms) that belongs to the common superimposable core.

PARAM.NAME: core-min-num-invariant-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimum number of residues (CA atoms) that belongs to the common superimposable core.

PARAM.NAME: divide-by-secondary-structure
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Split up target into smaller segments by secondary structure?

PARAM.NAME: sample-weighted-omega
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Samples omega from -155 to 155 through +/-180 and is weighted

PARAM.NAME: divide-and-conquer
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Split up target into smaller segments?

PARAM.NAME: divide-and-conquer-ignore-chain-breaks
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Allow bands to cross chain breaks?

PARAM.NAME: min-band-size
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimum band size.

PARAM.NAME: max-band-size
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum band size.

PARAM.NAME: comparative-benchmark
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparative modelling? This means the target will be selected from the alignment on the basis of the highest cumulative PID. This setting is overridden when a sequence is present in the alignment.

PARAM.NAME: comparative-target
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Entry to model

PARAM.NAME: dump-alignment-to-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Output alignment to a PIR file?

PARAM.NAME: minimum-sequence-separation
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: minimum-distance-from-terminus
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: framework
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: psa-library
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: PSA radii library

PARAM.NAME: atomic-scattering-factors-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Atomic scattering factor approximation data from CCP4

PARAM.NAME: cryst-d-high
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: High resolution limit for atomic scattering calculations. Useful for any crystallographic calculations. Should be set to the high limiting resolution of the crystal structure under consideration.

PARAM.NAME: chi-squared-electron-density-scoring
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: real-space-r-scoring
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: filter-models
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Filter the generated models by the bonded deviation and/or SASA.

PARAM.NAME: bonded-sigma-filter-%
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The percentage of models to keep after filtering by bonded-sigma.

PARAM.NAME: sasa-filter-%
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The percentage of models to keep after filtering by SASA.

PARAM.NAME: ellipsoidal-sd-scale-factor
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Factor to scale up the stddev to get the final semi axis lengths of the ellipsoids.

PARAM.NAME: min-vertical-occupancy
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimal vertical occupancy in the alignment at a particular position.

PARAM.NAME: exclude-insertions
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Exclude insertions/loops from target?

PARAM.NAME: exclude-deletions
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Exclude residues surrounding deletions in target.

PARAM.NAME: extra-threshold-margin-next-to-gap
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Restraint threshold margin for being next to a gap.

PARAM.NAME: min-vertical-occupancy-in-alignment
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimal vertical occupancy in alignment. For excluding loops due to missing information (templates).

PARAM.NAME: max-ca-distance-between-aligned-residues
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum distance between equivalent CA atoms.

PARAM.NAME: comparative-centroid-conservation-file
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: File containing the table with centroid--centroid distances according to PID and residue types. For comparative modelling.

PARAM.NAME: display-individual-templates-in-kinemage
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Display templates individually instead of as collective group in the Kinemage file?

PARAM.NAME: max-take-n-templates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of templates to use for comparative modelling.

PARAM.NAME: filter-distant-homologs
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Filter homologs from alignment? Requires minimal-pid-of-templates to be set.

PARAM.NAME: min-pid-of-templates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimal percentage sequence identity (%) of included templates from alignment.

PARAM.NAME: max-pid-difference-to-best-template
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximal percentage sequence identity difference to best included template.

PARAM.NAME: skip-n-best-templates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Number of templates to skip. Useful for benchmarking.

PARAM.NAME: max-divergence-for-bootstrap
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum structural divergence (max distance between aligned CA atoms) for safe bootstrapping.

PARAM.NAME: bootstrap-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Bootstrap restraint radius in Angstroms.

PARAM.NAME: min-semi-axis-length-ellipsoid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimum ellipsoid size

PARAM.NAME: min-semi-axis-length-ellipsoid-sidechain
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Minimum ellipsoid size for the sidechain centroid

PARAM.NAME: max-semi-axis-length-ellipsoid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum ellipsoid size

PARAM.NAME: max-templates-to-visualize
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of templates/structures to output to single PDB file

PARAM.NAME: max-fragments-to-visualize
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of models to output to single PDB file

PARAM.NAME: ss-bridges
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: A string in the form of "RES1-RES2:STRICTNESS,..." that adds disulfide bridges between pairs of residues RES1 and RES2 with a strictness of STRICTNESS. STRICTNESS must lie between 0 (residues must be near each other) to 3 (enforce correct SS covalent geometry).

PARAM.NAME: benchmark
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The native structure to compare our models to.

PARAM.NAME: print-non-ideal-geometry-violations
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we print covalent geometry violation (large deviations for ideal bond lengths and angles) for structures that we suspect are not ideal (for instance, the mainchain of proteins read from the PDB?

PARAM.NAME: max-hbond-backbone-h-o-distance
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: rgyr
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Maximum radius of gyration of generated models.

PARAM.NAME: surface-dots-kinemage
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: surface-dots-out
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: XXX

PARAM.NAME: fix-mislabeled-atoms
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Should we attempt to fix mislabelled atoms when reading PDB files?

PARAM.NAME: restrict-phipsi-by-templates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: use random phi psi from a map restricted by postion of ca of res i+2 ellipsoid restraints as defined by templates

PARAM.NAME: look-back-to-make-ca-ca
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: pass throu at pos - 1 to find min dist between Ca target and a sequence and to take that to calculate the dist between the pos -1 Ca sphere centre and Ca sphere about to be chosen to ensure it is approx 3.8A - calc on fly

PARAM.NAME: hold-info-to-make-ca-ca
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: pass throu at pos - 1 to find min dist between Ca target and a sequence and to take that to calculate the dist between the pos -1 Ca sphere centre and Ca sphere about to be chosen to ensure it is approx 3.8A - remember from last round

PARAM.NAME: use-consensus-values
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Find the consensus info from the templates for comparative mode

PARAM.NAME: print-phi-psi-templates
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Prints the info for various stages in restricting phi/psi by templates

PARAM.NAME: print-phi-psi-templates-child
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Prints the info for various stages in restricting phi/psi by templates

PARAM.NAME: use-average-template-omega
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: use the average omega value derived form the templates

PARAM.NAME: use-t-omega
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: use the average omega value derived form the templates or the real omega depending on the settings for use-average-template-omega and use-target-omega

PARAM.NAME: use-target-omega
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: use the average omega value derived form the templates

PARAM.NAME: parent_search_max
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If you want to limit the max number of children made by each parent

PARAM.NAME: parent_search_max_int
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If you want to limit the max number of children made by each parent

PARAM.NAME: use-all-frags
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If you want to get all the fragments made returned and joined then this needs to be true

PARAM.NAME: min-pid-to-restrict-template-use
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The min PID cutoff for the templates used to restrict the phi/psi used

PARAM.NAME: phi-psi-blur
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The blur on the max / min phi /psi angles used from the templates

PARAM.NAME: use-actual-phi-psi
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: take the phi and psi from the target. Use in special case of informed mode only.

PARAM.NAME: use-actual-tau
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: take the target tau and use that in building the residue

PARAM.NAME: print-tau-used
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: print of the target tau and use that in building the residue

PARAM.NAME: allow-unbuilt-bands
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: allow bands that have failes to go through. Only use if making more than one model

PARAM.NAME: use-borrow-rules
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: allow bands that have failes to go through. Only use if making more than one model

PARAM.NAME: use-feathered-clusters
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Adds a funell of restraints at the ends of the cluster lengths starting at n-3 with threshold at *1.2 n-2 with threshold at *1.5 and n-1 with threshold at *2 and reversed at the beginig of the next cluster

PARAM.NAME: sidechain-centroid-restraint-threshold-borrow
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the sidechain centroid restraints for the regions that can be borrowed as defined by ADANTE

PARAM.NAME: proline-non-clustered-threshold
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The radius, in Angstroms, of the mainchain centroid restraints for proline

PARAM.NAME: enforce-secondary-structure-restraints-comparative
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: This is for dividing the bands by secondary strucuture - allows the secondary strucutre to be passed down as a vector.

PARAM.NAME: restrict-sampling-by-pid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: This is to sample from templates with higher value PID values than more remote homologs

PARAM.NAME: print-NDF
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: print statements for debugging NDF

PARAM.NAME: restrict-bootstrap-sampling-by-pid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: This is to take the boostrap position from the closest template by pid if the divergance of all the templates is too large for bootstraping

PARAM.NAME: weight-sampling-by-pid
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Set the size of the restraint sphere based on the PID of the template being used.

PARAM.NAME: build-unbuildable-bands-backwards
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: As an alternative to restrict-bootstrap-sampling-by-pid option try building the unbuildable band backwards

PARAM.NAME: use-weightedDistibMean
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: Takes the pids of each template and pos of equivilent atoms and calaculates a gaussian distribution where the variance is proportional to the pid. The distributions are summed and the weighted mean of the new distriubtion is calculated.

PARAM.NAME: plot-means
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: plot the distributions of weightedDistibMean

PARAM.NAME: print-ca-mean-coord
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: prints the atom card pdb style with tthe coordinates of the mean postions - cen grep for it by using MCA

PARAM.NAME: print-ca-mean-coord-sidechain-centroids
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: prints the atom card pdb style with tthe coordinates of the mean postions for the sidechain centroid - cen grep for it by using MCA

PARAM.NAME: pid-window-size
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: The length of sequence to calculate the local pid centered at the residue being built

PARAM.NAME: only-ellipsoids
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: NDF

PARAM.NAME: use-CCP4i-file-name
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If using the CCP4i interface mode name files accordingly

PARAM.NAME: CCP4i-file-name
PARAM.DESCRIPTION: If using the CCP4i interface mode name files accordingly
